qas.question: What country sent their military to protect their interests in Samoa?
For how many years did the civil war in Samoa last?
How many contenders were vying for power in the war?
When did the crucial climax of the civil war occur?
What natural disaster put an end to the war in Apia harbour?

plausible_answers.text: business enterprise, harbour rights, and consulate office

qas.question: What interests were Samoans trying to protect?
For how many years did the civil war in Britain last?
What happened to cause the British civil war to come to an end?
How many Samoan parties were involved in the war?
On what date did the Samoans stand and fight for their own interests?

context: <a0_0>Britain<a0_0/> also sent troops to protect British <b5_0>business enterprise, harbour rights, and consulate office<b5_0/>. This was followed by an <a1_0><b6_0>eight<b6_0/><a1_0/>-year civil war, during which each of the <a2_0><b8_0>three<b8_0/><a2_0/> powers supplied arms, training and in some cases combat troops to the warring Samoan parties. The Samoan crisis came to a critical juncture in <a3_0><b9_0>March 1889<b9_0/><a3_0/> when all three colonial contenders sent warships into Apia harbour, and a larger-scale war seemed imminent. <a4_0><b7_0>A massive storm<b7_0/><a4_0/> on 15 March 1889 damaged or destroyed the warships, ending the military conflict.
